snippet: Apple joined the list of companies that have disclosed information about government surveillance, but many questions remain unanswered.
abstract: Technology companies are under fire after revelations that they secretly handed over customer information, including e-mails, in response to requests by federal government made in name of national security; rather than providing clarity, some disclosures have left many questions unanswered.

byline.original: By VINDU GOEL and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER

lead_paragraph: Apple joined the list of companies that have disclosed information about government surveillance, but many questions remain unanswered.

headline.main: More Data on Privacy, but Picture Is No Clearer
headline.print_headline: More Data On Privacy, But Picture Is No Clearer
